DOC.brief_summary: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term (5-8 years) functional prolapse recurrence rate of the 147 patients enrolled, randomized and analyzed in the study PRO-CURE I.
DOC.brief_title: UGYTEXÂ® Mesh Versus Subvesical Plication in the Surgical Treatment of Bladder Prolapse
DOC.detailed_description: Secondary objectives include comparing the following elements between the two randomized groups at a long-term time point (5-8 years): A. The anatomic failure rate of cystocele (POP-Q stage > or = 2) B. Late postoperative morbidity C. Residual post-operative pain (visual analog scale (VAS)) D. Patient satisfaction via the PGI-I questionnaire E. Quality of life via the PFDI and PFIQ questionnaires F. Sexual activity via the PISQ-12 questionnaire G. The rate of vaginal erosion H. Displacement and secondary shrinkage of meshs
DOC.criteria: The patient must have given her informed and signed consent The patient must be insured or beneficiary of a health insurance plan Patient included in, randomized and analysed in the PROCURE study (NCT00153257) The patient is under judicial protection, under tutorship or curatorship The patient refuses to sign the consent It is impossible to correctly inform the patient Patient not included in the PROCURE study
